result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A Reagan

request from from DA Office Green Bay
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear for plea/sentencing.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared.  Warrant continues.
Rescheduled plea & sentencing at email request of Atty Paul Fredrickson.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
body only
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant failed to appear for the plea/sentencing.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared.  Warrant authorized.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
waive reading of the information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered on his behalf.  Schedule plea/sentencing.
Information filed with the court.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court questioned the deefndant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
Waiver of Prelim at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared.  Defendant did not appear in person.  Having transportation issues.    Intending to waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant can appear by telephone.  No objection by the State.  Court attemped to call the defendant twice.  No answer, only voice mail.  Waiver rescheduled to 2/8/16 at 3 pm
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on K.N. to appear at 1/27 preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing at 01-27-2016 11:15 am

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: NCN Camp Ground, or associate with anyone using illegal drugs.

Pre-trial conference at 10-21-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-16-2015 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of waiving time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waive time limits.
